page.title: 15EDUCATION
page.content: This page is concerned, not with the local school, but with the education of the people who live in the village, who, as we have seen, come mainly from outside. We asked at what age schooling had been started and at what age finished. Most of the people started school at the age of four or earlier but the school leaving ages were much more varied. The majority had left school by sixteen but a significant number (18 out of 46 ) had stayed to 'A' level. Almost 50% had received no further education but the rest had either been apprentices or students at university or colleges of various kinds.
